Liffe.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: an organization for buying and selling business shares. In 2002 it was taken over by Euronext which joined the New York Stock Exchange in 2007 to form NYSE Euronext. The name Liffe is still used, however.
Liffe.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: London International Financial Futures and Options Exchange; the former name of a market for FUTURES (=contracts to buy something at a fixed price for delivery on a fixed date), and OPTIONs (=the right to buy shares, currencies etc at a fixed price during a particular period of time). It was taken over by Euronext in 2002 and is now called Euronext.liffe
